description: Individuals, communities, and organizations have found ways to address even the most egregious state abuses of human rights and other injustices. Using comparative analysis, this course considers cases and theories of nonviolent personal and political resistance and the factors that appear to contribute to people taking action and to successful responses. Students research and analyze cases of their choosing in light of the literature. Prerequisites: PSCI 220 and at least one course in the subfield or permission of instructor.
name: Sem: Courageous Resistance
notes: Only open to rising seniors during web registration.
Rising juniors may add on a space available basis during the drop/add period.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: PSCI 220 and at least one course in the subfield or permission of instructor.
title: Seminar: Courageous Resistance to Injustice
